intro: Calycolpus lucens, commonly known as the golden lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble lilies, with a spatulate inflorescence. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in marshy areas near water bodies. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for horticultural purposes.
